items.value: %113% reports that %111% appears to be preparing for an imminent assault on %112%.
%113% convinced %01% to not do anything stupid and hold back their attack against %111%. The leader is not someone to be persuaded easily but somehow %113% managed to do it. Wonder why that is?
%01% decided to lay low for a while and not attack %111%. Some would say it was a wise decision.
%113% did everything it could do, as in absolutely everything, but %111% is still cannot be persuaded. The urge to attack is stronger than it seems.
%01% will not hesitate to attack %111%. This means war!
%113% successfully performed a very dangerous ritual to enhance the strength of %01%'s units. It's good that it worked well because who knows one single mistake could do?
%113% successfully performed a very dangerous ritual to enhance the strength of %01%'s units.
%113% got one ingredient of the ritual wrong and as a result, it weakened their assault units instead. %01% is pissed.
%113% got one ingredient of the ritual wrong and as a result, it weakened their assault units instead. %01% is pissed.
%113% managed to manipulate the %01% to attack %111% instead.
%113% managed to manipulate the %01% to attack %111% instead.
%113% did not intervene with the assault plans of %01%.
%113% did not intervene with the assault plans of %01%.
